title: Jehoshaphat’s Reforms
summary: After the war, Jehoshaphat is rebuked by a prophet for allying with the wicked. He repents and initiates widespread judicial reform, appointing judges and encouraging them to rule in the fear of God.

faq.question: What was Jehoshaphat’s response to correction?
faq.answer: He took the rebuke seriously and made reforms to honor the Lord.

faq.question: What reforms did he implement?
faq.answer: He appointed judges and priests to settle disputes faithfully.
